title: Polymorph trap
data:
A **polymorph trap** is a type of [trap](/wiki/Trap "Trap") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and [polymorphs](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") monsters that move onto its square, including the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Use by monsters](#Use_by_monsters)

- [4 Strategy](#Strategy)

  - [4.1 Protecting yourself](#Protecting_yourself)
  - [4.2 Polymorphing pets](#Polymorphing_pets)
  - [4.3 Preventing monster use](#Preventing_monster_use)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)
  - [5.1 SporkHack](#SporkHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Polymorph traps are only generated on floors starting from dungeon level 8 in any [dungeon branch](/wiki/Dungeon_branch "Dungeon branch"), with the exception of [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

A polymorph trap is always generated on the locate level of the [Wizard quest](/wiki/Wizard_quest "Wizard quest").

## Description

If a character steps on a polymorph trap and does not have either [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") or [unchanging](/wiki/Unchanging "Unchanging"), the following will occur:

- If you have [polymorph control](/wiki/Polymorph_control "Polymorph control"), you get to choose which monster to become.
- If you are wearing dragon scales or dragon scale mail, you turn into that color dragon.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) If you were also wearing a cloak, it will be ripped apart (destroyed). Wearing gray dragon scale mail will prevent the polymorph from happening.
- If you have [lycanthropy](/wiki/Lycanthropy "Lycanthropy"), you switch between your animal and were forms.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)
- If you are a [vampire](/wiki/Vampire "Vampire") or [vampire bat](/wiki/Vampire_bat "Vampire bat"), you switch between the two.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)
- Otherwise, you have a (19-[Con](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution"))/20 chance of suffering a system shock: you sustain d30 damage and abuse your constitution.

If none of the above happened, you either polymorph into a random monster for 500-999 turns,[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) shorter if your polymorphed level is higher than your native level, or if you polymorph into your own race and see: "You feel like a new \<race>". This redistributes your [attributes](/wiki/Attribute "Attribute") and changes your [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") by up to two levels.

This transformation will destroy your shirt, body armor and cloak if you polymorph into something large or bigger, a non-humanoid medium or bigger, or a [winged gargoyle](/wiki/Winged_gargoyle "Winged gargoyle") or [marilith](/wiki/Marilith "Marilith") (wings and extra arms don't fit).

A polymorph trap that successfully polymorphs a character disappears afterward - magic resistance and unchanging protect the character and preserve the trap, while a character's magic resistance also protects their [steed](/wiki/Steed "Steed"). Note that although magic resistance protects the steed when the trap is first entered, the use of a magic whistle while on the trap will cause the steed to polymorph, and if the new pet is not ridable, cause you to fall off (at least in 3.4.3).

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Polymorph traps can be removed by zapping them with the spell or wand of cancellation. The trap will explode for 23 to 38 damage.

## Use by monsters

If a monster uses a polymorph trap, the [normal sounds](/wiki/Polymorph#Armor "Polymorph") will be heard for a shapeshift. Note that if you have [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") and you see a monster standing still and polymorphing, it could be either a polymorph trap or a [shapeshifter](/wiki/Shapeshifter "Shapeshifter").

A polymorph trap turns a monster into any of 269 equally likely, non-human, non-limited-edition species.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

Monsters can [resist](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") polymorph traps.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10) Polymorph traps count as a wand for these purposes (level 12).

Monsters may deliberately jump onto polymorph traps if their [monster difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") is at most five, or simply blunder onto them.[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)[\[12\]](#cite_note-12)[\[13\]](#cite_note-13) Even if monsters deliberately jump onto the trap, they still have a greater chance of becoming out-of-depth monsters than if they had used an item of polymorph.[\[14\]](#cite_note-14)

For this reason, it's safest not to traverse the lower areas of the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines") until one has [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") and is sufficiently powerful to deal with monsters like [jabberwocks](/wiki/Jabberwock "Jabberwock"), [liches](/wiki/Lich "Lich"), and [vampires](/wiki/Vampire "Vampire") that can potentially be created by these traps.

## Strategy

### Protecting yourself

If you have valuable armor which you would rather not have destroyed by the trap, you can proceed in relative safety by searching ([s](/wiki/S "S")) every square until you find it. This strategy works best if you have high [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck"). Contrary to popular belief, a [pair of lenses](/wiki/Pair_of_lenses "Pair of lenses") and the enchantment on [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur") have no effect on the chance of finding a trap. Characters with low [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") may have to search many times to reveal an adjacent trap – see [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone"), [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice"), [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar"), and [unicorn](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn") on how to improve your Luck. A [crystal ball](/wiki/Crystal_ball "Crystal ball") or [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") [scroll of gold detection](/wiki/Scroll_of_gold_detection "Scroll of gold detection") will reliably reveal the location of polymorph traps on the level, although a crystal ball is not safe to use with low [intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence"). A [wand of secret door detection](/wiki/Wand_of_secret_door_detection "Wand of secret door detection") may be zapped in rooms to determine if a polymorph trap is present; the [spell of detect unseen](/wiki/Spellbook_of_detect_unseen "Spellbook of detect unseen") has the same effect.

If you do not have [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"), there are other ways to reliably protect yourself from polymorph traps. Wearing a [ring of polymorph control](/wiki/Ring_of_polymorph_control "Ring of polymorph control") is good protection against polymorph traps, as you can always choose a safe form into which to polymorph. An [amulet of unchanging](/wiki/Amulet_of_unchanging "Amulet of unchanging") will also protect you from transforming.

You can mitigate the effects of breaking your shirt, body armor, and cloak by enchanting other armor pieces that are unlikely to be destroyed or replaced, such as [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves") or a [helm](/wiki/Helm "Helm").

The presence of out-of-depth monsters, or unusual, [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom")-only, or non-randomly generated monsters such as [woodchucks](/wiki/Woodchuck "Woodchuck"), is a likely indicator of a polymorph trap on the level. If several unusual monsters are grouped in a single area a polymorph trap is almost certainly nearby; check this with [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy"). Proceed with caution. If you are in the Mines, and either gnomes or dwarves are peaceful to you, then a grouping of peaceful monsters that should normally be hostile, no matter what the depth, is a solid sign of a polymorph trap (i.e. a peaceful long worm and minotaur at Mine's End).

### Polymorphing pets

If you are immune to being polymorphed, you can displace your pet onto the trap to have it turn into a random monster. You can keep doing this until your pet is something useful or powerful, or turns into a (baby) [gray dragon](/wiki/Gray_dragon "Gray dragon"), at which point it too is magic resistant, and is no longer affected by the trap. If you aren't immune to being polymorphed, consider using a leash on your pet and standing next to a polymorph trap. Chances for a pet to walk over the trap are much higher this way. Another way is to push boulders to make a two square trap and thus forcing your pet to move between the trap and an empty space. After a desirable morph is reached, you can block the trap with a boulder.

You can also use a [magic whistle](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle") to make your pet land on the trap until you get a desirable morph or a [gray dragon](/wiki/Gray_dragon "Gray dragon"). Combine the polymorph trap and magic whistle with some pet treats like [tripe](/wiki/Tripe "Tripe") or a horse friendly treat like an apple and you can get a pretty nice pet. Note: pets that eat in your presence tend to stay tame longer. The [winged gargoyle](/wiki/Winged_gargoyle "Winged gargoyle") is a great pet, but it doesn't eat. Standing on the trap and displacing the correct pet onto it works best. Each move, you have 6/7 chance of swapping places (never if it's a [long worm](/wiki/Long_worm "Long worm") or you are [punished](/wiki/Punishment "Punishment")),[\[15\]](#cite_note-15) 1/7 chance if it is sessile.[\[16\]](#cite_note-16)

If you have neither magic resistance nor a magic whistle, you have no way to cause a [sessile](/wiki/Sessile "Sessile") pet to be polymorphed by the trap; generating one of these (such as a [blue jelly](/wiki/Blue_jelly "Blue jelly")), would end the attempt, but at least protect the trap from other monsters.

If your pet is polymorphed into a pudding, you may want to try to split it, possibly yielding more pets to polymorph. As the name is cloned along with it, you may want to rename one. See [Abuse](/wiki/Tameness#Abuse "Tameness") for ramifications of attacking and splitting your pet. Follow the usual advice on splitting puddings if you are not familiar; doing this carelessly is an easy way to accidentally kill your pet.

### Preventing monster use

Polymorph traps are a resource, but they can also be quite dangerous if you leave them lying around unprotected: some weak but intelligent monsters will willingly jump into the trap to likely become something stronger (luckily including pets), which can be a bad thing depending on how much stronger it becomes. In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"), you could protect a polymorph trap by dropping an item and engraving [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") on it. This would prevent most monsters from stepping onto the trap. Alternatively, if you didn't have protection from the trap, you could drop an item and engrave Elbereth on each tile adjacent to the trap. You can also dig down on the polymorph trap with a [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe"): since only one [trap](/wiki/Trap "Trap") can exist on a square, the resultant [pit](/wiki/Pit "Pit") will remove the polymorph trap. Pushing a [boulder](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder") on the trap will only protect it from most monsters – notably, tiny ones can still use it. (In case no boulders are handy, you can make a boulder fall down stairs by throwing a non-rock object onto it.)

## Variants

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), pets that are polymorhped by a polymorph trap will use up the trap.

This transformation will destroy your shirt, body armor and cloak if you polymorph into something large or bigger, a non-humanoid medium or bigger, or a [[winged gargoyle]] or [[marilith]] (wings and extra arms don't fit).

A polymorph trap that successfully polymorphs a character disappears afterward - magic resistance and unchanging protect the character and preserve the trap, while a character's magic resistance also protects their [[steed]]. Note that although magic resistance protects the steed when the trap is first entered, the use of a magic whistle while on the trap will cause the steed to polymorph, and if the new pet is not ridable, cause you to fall off (at least in 3.4.3).

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Polymorph traps can be removed by zapping them with the spell or wand of cancellation. The trap will explode for 23 to 38 damage.}}

==Use by monsters==
If a monster uses a polymorph trap, the [[Polymorph#Armor|normal sounds]] will be heard for a shapeshift. Note that if you have [[telepathy]] and you see a monster standing still and polymorphing, it could be either a polymorph trap or a [[shapeshifter]].

A polymorph trap turns a monster into any of 269 equally likely, non-human, non-limited-edition species.{{refsrc|trap.c|2121}}{{refsrc|mon.c|2412}}{{refsrc|mon.c|2376}}

Monsters can [[Magic resistance (monster)|resist]] polymorph traps.{{refsrc|trap.c|1253|comment= monsters may resist polymorph traps}} Polymorph traps count as a wand for these purposes (level 12).

Monsters may deliberately jump onto polymorph traps if their [[monster difficulty]] is at most five, or simply blunder onto them.{{reffunc|muse.c|find_misc}}{{reffunc|muse.c|use_misc}}{{refsrc|monmove.c|1049}} Even if monsters deliberately jump onto the trap, they still have a greater chance of becoming out-of-depth monsters than if they had used an item of polymorph.{{refsrc|muse.c|1789}}

For this reason, it's safest not to traverse the lower areas of the [[Gnomish Mines]] until one has [[magic resistance]] and is sufficiently powerful to deal with monsters like [[jabberwock]]s, [[lich]]es, and [[vampire]]s that can potentially be created by these traps.

==Strategy==
===Protecting yourself===
If you have valuable armor which you would rather not have destroyed by the trap, you can proceed in relative safety by searching ({{kbd|s}}) every square until you find it. This strategy works best if you have high [[Luck]]. Contrary to popular belief, a [[pair of lenses]] and the enchantment on [[Excalibur]] have no effect on the chance of finding a trap. Characters with low [[Luck]] may have to search many times to reveal an adjacent trap – see [[luckstone]], [[sacrifice]], [[altar]], and [[unicorn]] on how to improve your Luck. A [[crystal ball]] or [[confused]] [[scroll of gold detection]] will reliably reveal the location of polymorph traps on the level, although a crystal ball is not safe to use with low [[intelligence]]. A [[wand of secret door detection]] may be zapped in rooms to determine if a polymorph trap is present; the [[spellbook of detect unseen|spell of detect unseen]] has the same effect.

If you do not have [[magic resistance]], there are other ways to reliably protect yourself from polymorph traps. Wearing a [[ring of polymorph control]] is good protection against polymorph traps, as you can always choose a safe form into which to polymorph. An [[amulet of unchanging]] will also protect you from transforming. 

You can mitigate the effects of breaking your shirt, body armor, and cloak by enchanting other armor pieces that are unlikely to be destroyed or replaced, such as [[gloves]] or a [[helm]].

The presence of out-of-depth monsters, or unusual, [[Gehennom]]-only, or non-randomly generated monsters such as [[woodchuck]]s, is a likely indicator of a polymorph trap on the level. If several unusual monsters are grouped in a single area a polymorph trap is almost certainly nearby; check this with [[telepathy]]. Proceed with caution.  If you are in the Mines, and either gnomes or dwarves are peaceful to you, then a grouping of peaceful monsters that should normally be hostile, no matter what the depth, is a solid sign of a polymorph trap (i.e. a peaceful long worm and minotaur at Mine's End).

===Polymorphing pets===
If you are immune to being polymorphed, you can displace your pet onto the trap to have it turn into a random monster. You can keep doing this until your pet is something useful or powerful, or turns into a (baby) [[gray dragon]], at which point it too is magic resistant, and is no longer affected by the trap. If you aren't immune to being polymorphed, consider using a leash on your pet and standing next to a polymorph trap. Chances for a pet to walk over the trap are much higher this way. Another way is to push boulders to make a two square trap and thus forcing your pet to move between the trap and an empty space. After a desirable morph is reached, you can block the trap with a boulder.

You can also use a [[magic whistle]] to make your pet land on the trap until you get a desirable morph or a [[gray dragon]]. Combine the polymorph trap and magic whistle with some pet treats like [[tripe]] or a horse friendly treat like an apple and you can get a pretty nice pet. Note: pets that eat in your presence tend to stay tame longer. The [[winged gargoyle]] is a great pet, but it doesn't eat. Standing on the trap and displacing the correct pet onto it works best. Each move, you have 6/7 chance of swapping places (never if it's a [[long worm]] or you are [[punishment|punished]]),{{refsrc|uhitm.c|318}} 1/7 chance if it is sessile.{{refsrc|uhitm.c|338}}

If you have neither magic resistance nor a magic whistle, you have no way to cause a [[sessile]] pet to be polymorphed by the trap; generating one of these (such as a [[blue jelly]]), would end the attempt, but at least protect the trap from other monsters.

If your pet is polymorphed into a pudding, you may want to try to split it, possibly yielding more pets to polymorph. As the name is cloned along with it, you may want to rename one. See [[Tameness#Abuse|Abuse]] for ramifications of attacking and splitting your pet. Follow the usual advice on splitting puddings if you are not familiar; doing this carelessly is an easy way to accidentally kill your pet.

===Preventing monster use===
Polymorph traps are a resource, but they can also be quite dangerous if you leave them lying around unprotected: some weak but intelligent monsters will willingly jump into the trap to likely become something stronger (luckily including pets), which can be a bad thing depending on how much stronger it becomes. In [[NetHack 3.4.3]], you could protect a polymorph trap by dropping an item and engraving [[Elbereth]] on it. This would prevent most monsters from stepping onto the trap. Alternatively, if you didn't have protection from the trap, you could drop an item and engrave Elbereth on each tile adjacent to the trap. You can also dig down on the polymorph trap with a [[pick-axe]]: since only one [[trap]] can exist on a square, the resultant [[pit]] will remove the polymorph trap. Pushing a [[boulder]] on the trap will only protect it from most monsters – notably, tiny ones can still use it. (In case no boulders are handy, you can make a boulder fall down stairs by throwing a non-rock object onto it.)

In [[SporkHack]], pets that are polymorhped by a polymorph trap will use up the trap.
